title: Action Definition
description: Schema for defining a SoEasily platform action, its properties, author, inputs, outputs, and documentation.

id.description: A globally unique identifier for the SoEasily action, including a namespace. Uses snake_case.

version.description: The semantic version of this action definition.

author.description: Details about the author of the action. External actions are identified by an author other than 'SoEasily'.

name.description: The name of the author or organization.

url.description: A URL to the author's website.

documentation_url.description: An optional link to the author's specific documentation for this action or collection.

support_url.description: An optional link to the author's support page or help desk.

title.description: A user-friendly title for the action, used in UIs and documentation headings.

description.description: A detailed explanation of the action's function. Supports Markdown.

category.description: The primary, high-level category for UI organization.

tags.description: A list of keywords for SEO and global platform search.

collection.description: Metadata for grouping and displaying the action within its author's set.

name.description: The name of the author-specific collection this action belongs to.

display_order.description: The sort order of this action within its collection.

icon_svg_name.description: The filename of the SVG icon associated with this action.

base_locale.description: The base language for this documentation file.

localized_versions.description: References to localized versions of this action definition.

handler.description: A pointer to the execution logic. For an external action, this could be the API endpoint URL to which the platform will proxy the request.

config_schema.description: A JSON Schema defining the configurable properties of the action.

input_schema.description: A JSON Schema defining the expected data input for the action.

output_schema.description: A JSON Schema defining the data output by the action.

credentials_schema.description: An optional JSON Schema defining any required credentials.

tests.description: Named tests demonstrating the action's behavior.
